results.extracted_text:
Paper 2: Graph-Based Models in Protein Interaction Networks
Abstract:
Graph neural networks (GNNs) are used to model complex protein interactions in cellular pathways.
Methodology:
Constructed interaction graphs from STRING database and applied GCNs for link prediction.
Datasets:
Datasets from STRING, BioGRID, and DIP were utilized.
Performance:
The model improved F1 score by 10% over previous SOTA methods....

Paper 3: Transfer Learning for Rare Disease Diagnosis
Abstract:
Transfer learning methods are applied to leverage large-scale medical imaging datasets for rare
disease prediction.
Methodology:
Fine-tuned pretrained ResNet and EfficientNet models for classifying rare pathologies.
Datasets:
Used NIH ChestXray14 and a rare disease subset curated from multiple hospitals.
Performance:
Reported AUC of 0.91 on unseen hospital data, highlighting generalization capabilities....

Paper 1: Deep Learning in Genomics
Abstract:
This paper explores deep learning models used in genomics, including CNNs and RNNs for DNA
sequence analysis.
Methodology:
We applied convolutional layers to encode genomic sequences and used LSTMs to capture
long-term dependencies.
Datasets:
We used ENCODE, TCGA, and synthetic DNA datasets.
Performance:
Achieved 92% accuracy on the test set, outperforming traditional bioinformatics tools....
